item.description:
The Coolidge Corner Theatre's Science on Screen series returns with a showing of B-movie maestro Roger Corman's 1960 cult classic THE LITTLE SHOP OF HORRORS, about a hapless plant-shop clerk who breeds a talking ("Feed Me! FEEED MEEEE!"), man-eating plant named Audrey Junior. Harvard ecologist Aaron Ellison introduces the hilarious black comedy with a talk about the bizarre and amazing world of carnivorous plants. More info at www.coolidge.org/science. Tix are $9.75 or $7.75 students and Museum of Science members. Coolidge members get in for free! Program starts at 7:00pm. More info:

http://www.coolidge.org/programs/science-on-screen

 

(Click the little blue time '7:00 pm' link to buy tickets online)
item.name: Science on Screen: Little Shop of Horrors with Ecologist Aaron Ellison
